intro: Thymus serpyllum f. borosianus, commonly known as the Borosian thyme, is a flowering plant belonging to the Lamiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its aromatic, gray-green foliage and small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant is native to southern Europe and thrives in well-drained soils in sunny conditions. It is often used in herbal medicine for its antiseptic and antioxidant properties. Its compact growth habit makes it suitable for rock gardens and as a ground cover.
